snippet: Discover how travel inspires these people to do what they love.
The Dow Jones industrial average and the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index ended at record highs, without adjustment for inflation, while the Nasdaq rose for an eighth day.
abstract: Stock markets respond favorably to Greek and eurozone finance ministers reaching deal to extend Greece's financial rescue, with Dow Jones industrial average and Standard & Poor's 500-stock index ending at record highs.

headline.main: Shares Rise as Greek Bailout Is Extended
headline.print_headline: Shares Rise as Greek Bailout Is Extended

snippet: The company has collected about 200 people over the last few years to develop technologies for an electric car, according to two people with knowledge of the company’s plans.
abstract: Apple has reportedly gathered about 200 people over past few years to develop technologies for electric car.

headline.main: Apple Is Forming an Auto Team
headline.print_headline: Auto Team Is Forming at Apple

byline.original: By BRIAN X. CHEN and MIKE ISAAC

snippet: The New York Times Company announced two new nominees for its board, Dara Khosrowshahi, the chief executive of Expedia, and Rebecca Van Dyck, a Facebook executive.
abstract: New York Times Company announces two nominees for its board, Dara Khosrowshahi, chief executive of Expedia, and Rebecca Van Dyck, Facebook executive.

snippet: The market sagged over all with the price of oil, but consumer stocks were led higher by Priceline, which reported better-than-forecast earnings.
abstract: Stocks of utility companies fall, bringing market down slightly.

headline.main: Slide in Utility Companies Nudges the Market Down
headline.print_headline: Markets Fall on Slide in Utility Companies
